title: Wheat Cultivation Guide
content: Plant wheat in well-drained loamy soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.5. Optimal sowing time is between late October and early December. Use certified seeds and maintain spacing of 20-22 cm between rows.

title: Rice Growing Tips
content: Rice requires a warm climate and plenty of water. Sow in nurseries and transplant after 20-30 days. Maintain a water level of 5-10 cm during the growing period and drain water before harvesting.

title: Maize Production Guide
content: Maize grows best in well-aerated, fertile soil. Ensure proper seed depth (2.5-5 cm) and maintain adequate irrigation, especially during flowering and grain filling stages.

title: Tomato Farming Basics
content: Grow tomatoes in slightly acidic soil (pH 6.0-6.8). Provide support for the plants, water regularly, and watch out for pests like whiteflies and aphids. Use mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds.

title: Potato Growing Techniques
content: Use certified disease-free seed potatoes. Plant in well-prepared, loose soil with good drainage. Mound soil around the base of the plant as it grows to protect tubers from sunlight.

title: Sugarcane Farming
content: Sugarcane thrives in tropical climates with rich, moist soil. Use healthy cane cuttings with 2-3 buds, spaced 30 cm apart. Regular irrigation and fertilization are essential for high yields.
